name: Renaissance Dallas Richardson Hotel

reviews.text: Great brand new business hotel. Room was spacious and clean. Housekeeping always did the room to perfection every day. Easy self-parking across the street.
reviews.title: Great hotel, new and roomy

reviews.text: Tip to those driving from the north: coming southbound on the N Central Expy my GPS would tell me to get off at Galatyn Pky, immediately get right back on the N Central Expy northbound, and immediately exit right to E Lookout Dr. Trouble is: the ramp from Galatyn Pky to the N Central Expy northbound puts you in the leftmost lane of the Expy, and you must exit right about 100 feet after you merge on the left, cutting across four lanes of traffic. While that can be done (illegally, but at least safely) at midnight, it is impossible at 5pm. The proper way to get there is to continue straight on the Galatyn Pky to the next intersection, turn left at Performance Dr, left again at Performance Ct, then right at Plaza Blvd to the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice, rooms on freeway side can get noisey.

reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend of the Dallas White Rock Marathon. Since I was running in the event I wanted a nice hotel close to DART (Dallas Area Rapid Transit). Interior of the hotel is very classy and arty. Paid parking is within easy walking distance if you decide to self park. Hotel staff was helpful and attentive to my needs.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved the Renaissance in Richardson, TX

likes.disliked: — I had to be moved 3 times out of rooms that had more surrounding noise before I was placed in the right room. Can't fault the hotel for not knowing, though. I could have told them ahead of time.

reviews.text: Since I did not utilize any of the hotel eating areas I really can't report on what they were like. I did stop by their coffee/Starbucks area one morning for a nice cup of hot coffee. There is also a conceiere and an area where you can gather pamphlets about shopping places, etc. This is where I obtained info on the DART system.
reviews.title: Excellent every time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was able to upgrade to a suite room I think for about $10 more a night. Very spacious clean room with a living area and separate bedroom with door. I was in a corner room that did have a wonderful view south of the hotel. Here was really my only gripe, if you get a room that faces Hwy 75, plan on traffic noise. The first night wasn't easy but for some reason by night two I was more adjusted to it. If I were to stay here again I would refuse a room facing the freeway.
reviews.title: Great Stay Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After my interview, the University brought my spouse and I back to see Dallas. They put us up in the same hotel and I was pleased. Our stay was more leisure this time and was excellent. My wife loved the hotel. I would add that the pool and workout facilities are excellent, the drinks at the bar are well done (and strong), and the food is huge portioned. Nice staff, clean, highly recommended.
reviews.title: A Return trip and equally satisfied

reviews.text: Good choice if you are in the Univ of Texas - Dallas area.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Rooms comfortable and well appointed, lobby and bar area are very spacious and comfortable. Pool and gym area are excellent.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, with one caveat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to train service (walkable).
reviews.title: Great Stay!

likes.disliked: — no one available at check in

reviews.text: Concierge lounge does a nice job with breakfast (did not try evening appetizers).
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed here due to evac from Hurricane. They gave us a $79 rate abd didn't even charge us a pet fee. First time staying in a Pet friendly hotel and to much my surprise this hotel was very clean. Has the Dart system right at the Hotel that can take you almost anywhere for only $3.00 per day. Has a indoor pool when raining and an outdoor water spray that my kids loved playing in. The food was also wonderful at the Hotel. I always stay in Marriott's and this was a top choice. First time my parents stay in a Marriott and they just loved this hotel and wanted to take the beds home with them. All the staff were very friendly and helpfull with letting us know where we could bring my children and entertain them. They even printed out driving maps for us. We didn't have any problems like other people have listed, no bed bugs either. Our rooms were very clean. My pet never has fleas and he didn't leave with fleas either.
reviews.title: Great Stay Overall....read

likes.liked: — clean, friendly staff, pet friendly, good food, Dart system

reviews.text: I stayed at this location a few months ago. Upon review from my travel agent I was clearly impressed, and when I arrived at the hotel it was artistically designed, a little over the top in some areas.
reviews.title: A Disapointment, Foil Service and BedBugs

likes.disliked: — Service, cleanliness of hotel, Foil staff

reviews.text: I went to have a meal at the restaurant, I waited for about 15 minutes with no service, and no one insight to ask so I left and went out to have something to eat. Very Poor service indeed.
reviews.title: Was a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed the night as scheduled. I woke up the next morning covered in bed bugs. I complained to the Front Desk staff who seemed barely affected by it. My room was changed but I couldn't stay there.
reviews.title: A newer Marriott that already feels dated

likes.liked: — Excellent weekend rate and good restaurant by any standard
likes.disliked: — Tired rooms, dismal location without a car (parking fee if you have one)

reviews.text: For the above reasons I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Just Average stay
So Great
reviews.text: I had no pre-set expectations of this hotel and can't say enough about this hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend it and/or stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - At check-in the service was quick and friendly. I was offered an upgrade for a small charge which I accepted.
reviews.title: Loved the Renaissance

reviews.text: - The lobby/common area of the hotel is beautiful. Great art, water fountains, and furniture that I wanted to steal and take home with me.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have stayed at in long time

reviews.text: - The suite was awesome. It's larger than a similar suite that you would find at Embassy Suites. 4 walls of windows (2 large corners) gave beautiful views in two directions.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the Richardson, TX area
No internet connections
reviews.text: - The bathroom had special touches such as a towel folded into a basket with bath petals and a rubber duck inside.

description: Renaissance Dallas Richardson Hotel located right off of Hwy 75 North bound at the Galatyn Park (DART rail)exit and next to The Eisemann Center. Right in the center of the Richardson telecom corridor. Modern ecletic decor featuring hand blown glass work by atrist Jim Bowman. AAA Four Diamond Hotel with all of the expected amenities and services of a Renaissance. A warm Texas hospitality through out the hotel and expert Navigators to help you to "Live Life To Discover."
